Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially grey in section, the interior is slightly ribbed and covered with a cream-coloured deposit, the exterior is covered with a buff-coloured slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393258) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393258)
